meanings.definition: A woman who inherits property along with one or more others.
meanings.sent1: The coheiress received the family estate after her grandmother passed away.
meanings.sent2: She was named as a coheiress in her uncle's will, along with her siblings.
meanings.sent3: The coheiress was surprised to find out she inherited a collection of antique teacups.
meanings.sent4: As the coheiress of the business empire, she had big responsibilities on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The coheiress eagerly awaited the reading of the will to see what she would inherit.

meanings.definition: A woman who shares an inheritance with others.
meanings.sent1: The coheiress and her cousins divided the family heirlooms equally.
meanings.sent2: She became a coheiress to the vast fortune left by her late grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The coheiress joked that they should all wear matching tiaras to celebrate their inheritance.
meanings.sent4: Being a coheiress meant she had to navigate sharing decisions with her co-beneficiaries.
meanings.sent5: The coheiress felt grateful to have siblings to share the inheritance with.
